problem_text: Assume that all gases are perfect and that data refer to 298 K unless otherwise stated. Find an expression for the change in entropy when two blocks of the same substance and of equal mass, one at the temperature $T_{\mathrm{h}}$ and the other at $T_{\mathrm{c}}$, are brought into thermal contact and allowed to reach equilibrium. Evaluate the change for two blocks of copper, each of mass $500 \mathrm{~g}$, with $C_{p, \mathrm{~m}}=24.4 \mathrm{~J} \mathrm{~K}^{-1}$ $\mathrm{mol}^{-1}$, taking $T_{\mathrm{h}}=500 \mathrm{~K}$ and $T_{\mathrm{c}}=250 \mathrm{~K}$.
